title: Bug 6410 - File marked as dirty even though it is unchanged by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirty even though no changes are made by the code assist. This prevents the code assist from functioning properly.
OB: With a Java file open, placing the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call and pressing CtrlSpace does not bring up code assist. Additionally, the file is marked as dirty, indicating a change has been made even though no changes have actually been made.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:  

1. Open a Java file.  
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. 
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor in the code snippet below: 
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I); 
4. Press CtrlSpace to invoke code assist.
